intro: Acinodendron acalephoides, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and toxicity, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
